metadata.title: YouTube Research Process 2025: Find Topics That Get Views
metadata.description: Master YouTube topic research. Find video ideas that your audience wants.

hero.headline: YouTube Research Process Guide
hero.subheadline: Find topics people actually want. Research before you create.

sections.content: Most creators guess what to make and hope for the best. Systematic research removes guesswork. Understanding what your audience searches for, what competitors succeed with, and where gaps exist means every video has demand before you film it. Research is the highest-ROI activity in content creation.

sections.title: Research Process
content: Start with broad topic in your niche
Note view counts and upload dates
Look for gaps—topics not well covered

faq.question: How much research before filming?
faq.answer: At minimum: check autocomplete, look at top 5 videos for topic, read comments. Can be 15 minutes. Deep research for important topics might be hours. Always some research—never just guess.

faq.question: What makes a good topic?
faq.answer: High search demand, achievable competition, fits your niche, you can deliver value. Best topics have demand but aren't dominated by huge channels. Look for 'goldilocks' opportunities.

faq.question: How to find gaps in content?
faq.answer: Comments asking questions not answered. Old videos ranking (audience wants fresh). Related topics with no good videos. Your unique angle on common topic. Specific variations of broad topics.

faq.question: Should I only make researched content?
faq.answer: Research should inform most content. But passion projects and experiments valuable too. 70% research-backed, 30% creative exploration reasonable balance. Data + creativity = best results.
